title: Accra Hosts Rugby Festival
text:
16:37 CET Accra Hosts Rugby Festival By Daily Guide 
The Ghana Rugby Football Union (GRFU) will organise a rugby festival on 24 October 2015 at the Accra Sports Stadium. 
The first of its kind in the history of rugby in Ghana, the festival will include a Men 7s tournament between Championship League clubs, a Women 7s match as well as a Boys 7s match. 
The festival will conclude on a high note with an international friendly Men 15s match between Ghana and Togo. 
Commenting on the festival, president of the Ghana Rugby Football Union (GRFU), Herbert Mensah, stated: 'Ghana Rugby is in a rebuilding phase and it is events such as the Accra Festival that will give momentum to the rebuilding process. Never before has a tournament that includes Men 7s, Women 7s, Boys 7s and an international match been held.' 
The festival will kick off at 9am with a Men 7s tournament between Championship League clubs that will include teams such as Griffons from Cape Coast, Cosmos Buffaloes, Idas, Dansoman Hurricanes, Legon Titans, Accra Sharks and Tema Anchors. 
'In discussions between myself and the president of the Togo Rugby Federation, Modeste Akassan, we came to the conclusion that it is essential for Rugby development in the region that regional Rugby Unions work much closer together to promote and develop Rugby. The friendly international on Saturday is a first small step towards achieving that objective and I hope it will be the beginning of much greater things to come,' Mr Mensah said. 
In 2014 /15 Ghana Rugby successfully concluded its first professional Ghana Rugby Club Championship (GRCC) where ten teams competed on a home-and-away round-robin basis. 
Cosmos Buffaloes won the championship trophy in an exciting final with Legon Titans. 
The 2015/16 Ghana Rugby Club Championship is scheduled to be played between November 2015 and February 2016. Sports News Follow Us Problems rotate their hosts. Today, it´s Ali, tomorrow it´s Seidu. Your turn will come. By: Adwoa Ayamba
